summary: This is an email chain from August 29, 2019, between individuals at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discussing voicemail tips received about Jeffrey Epstein and coordinating a 5 pm interview. The correspondence indicates active investigative follow-up on tips shortly after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of an email forwarding voicemails about Epstein to colleagues, requesting they be handled or passed to the FBI tip line.

events.title: Epstein Tip Follow-up and Interview
events.description: Email correspondence discussing voicemail tips received about Jeffrey Epstein and confirming a 5 pm interview scheduled for that day.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 29, 2019, discussing investigative activity related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York received multiple voicemail tips regarding Epstein that were deemed to have potential investigative value.
A 5 pm interview was scheduled for August 29, 2019, as part of the ongoing investigation.
The correspondence shows coordination between prosecutors and the FBI tip line regarding the handling of tips about Epstein.
